Title: CAN congratulates Catholic Church on election of Pope Leo XIV
Summary: CAN says emergence of Pope Leo XIV signifies renewal and hope for Catholic Church . CAN expressed confidence that the Catholic Church will continue to rebuild its strength .

Title: Food security: Kwara government empowers farmers with tractors, inputs
Summary: Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq has launched the distribution of tractors and agricultural inputs to farmers across the 16 LGAs .

Title: Lagos govt extends removal notices over Ikota River setbacks
Summary: The Lagos State Government has extended the removal notice to property owners whose buildings are around the Ikota River setback areas, specifically in Oral Estate, Westend, Megamounds, and Lekki .

Title: Akpabio, Sowore, Okpebhole slam Peter Obi over criticisms
Summary: Senate President Godswill Akpabio advised Peter Obi to focus on resolving internal crises within his party before aspiring to lead Nigeria . His remarks came during the Valedictory Session in honour of the late Senator Peter Obi .

Title: Last 15 Popes: Nationalities, years of pontificate
Summary: As the Catholic Church enters a new chapter, it is fitting to look back at the last 15 Popes . Following the selection of a new pope–Leo XIV– yesterday, global attention has turned once again to the rich and complex history of the papacy .

Title: NPCL, Dangote move to settle rift after months of rivalry
Summary: NPCL, Dangote move to settle rift after months of rivalry . The companies pledged to deepen collaboration aimed at ensuring Nigeria’s energy security .

Title: Liverpool sad to lose Trent Alexander-Arnold but a new player will step up, says Slot
Summary: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says everyone at the club is "disappointed" by Trent Alexander-Arnold's decision to leave Anfield at the end of the season . Liverpool boss Slot says a new player will step up to replace the left-back .

Title: Tinubu’s hitch-free visit confirms Anambra is safe— Police
Summary: Tinubu inaugurated the Anambra State Government House, Solution Fun City, the Governor’s and Presidential lodges . The visit was hitch-free, according to the police .

Title: CAN congratulates Catholic Church on election of Pope Leo XIV
Summary: CAN congratulates Catholic Church on election of Pope Leo XIV . The Christian Association of Nigeria has sent its congratulatory message to the Roman Catholic Church .

Title: AEDC staff brutally murdered in Nasarawa
Summary: Tension has gripped the Tudun Kauri area of Lafia, Nasarawa State, following the brutal murder of a 37-year-old man . Yusuf Ibrahim Kasimu is believed to have been killed by suspected assassins .

Title: Egg producers decry poor sales, seek govt intervention
Summary: The Poultry Farmers' Association of Nigeria has raised concerns over the declining sales of eggs in the country . The situation is further exacerbated by the rising costs of production, including feed and other inputs, according to the group .

Title: Leo XIV says Church must fight 'lack of faith' in first mass as pope
Summary: Chicago-born Robert Francis Prevost became the first US head of the 2,000-year institution on Thursday . Pope Leo XIV urged the Catholic Church to “desperately” counter a lack of faith in his first homily as pope . The former missionary deplored “settings in which the Christian faith is considered absurd

Title: Kogi JSC retires judge compulsorily, suspends magistrate
Summary: The Kogi State Judicial Service Commission has ordered the compulsory retirement of a judge, Alemeru Adekunle Bamidele, of the Area Court over misconduct . The commission also suspended Magistrate Tanimu U. Muhammed from adjudicatory duties for two years and issued him a warning letter . These decisions were taken

Title: Lawmaker lauds Tinubu over Usoro Akpabio's SSDC MD appointment
Summary: Okpolupm Etteh has commended President Bola Tinubu for appointing Usoro Akpabio as the Managing Director of the newly established South-South Development Commission . The lawmaker representing Eket/Onna/Esit Eket Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives said her leadership could unlock unprecedented development

Title: Oyo begins demolition of shanties, illegal structures
Summary: The Oyo State Government, on Thursday, commenced the demolition of illegal structures and shanties at different locations in Ibadan, the state capital . The exercise began at St. Gabriel’s Secondary Commercial School, Sabo-Jembewon Area . The Executive Order, as issued in 2023 by the State Governor
